entries.title: Watch: Prince Harry's new memoir exposes him and Meghan as resident crazy people
entries.description:
In a continuation of the "The Royal Family is Racist" saga, Prince Harry gave a 60 Minutes interview with Anderson Cooper about his upcoming memoir, "Spare." 60 Minutes tweeted out this clip ahead of its release, where Prince Harry said he was "probably bigoted" before he married Meghan Markle.

\u201cPrince Harry tells @andersoncooper, "I was probably bigoted before the relationship with Meghan." See the interview, Sunday on 60 Minutes. https://t.co/5XclKEFFVY\u201d
— 60 Minutes (@60 Minutes) 1672962271

He also said he doesn't see himself ever returning as a member of the Royal Family:

\u201c\u201cCan you see a day when you would return as a full-time member of the Royal Family?\n\nSee Prince Harry\u2019s revealing interview with @andersoncooper.\n\n60 Minutes Sunday, on @CBS and streaming on @paramountplus.\u201d
— 60 Minutes (@60 Minutes) 1672700112

He and Meghan stepped back from their royal duties in 2020. In 2021, they gave a controversial interview with Oprah Winfrey. This was when Markle claimed she was suicidal because of racism, and that Harry's family was concerned about how dark their son would be.

\u201cThis week's bombshell Oprah Winfrey interview with Prince Harry and Meghan Markle shone a light on the ways London's tabloid newspapers have come to box the royal family into "a trapping environment." https://t.co/b6XKDQcaRo\u201d
— CBS Sunday Morning \ud83c\udf1e (@CBS Sunday Morning \ud83c\udf1e) 1615728106

I can't speak to the allegations of racism. But Prince Harry and Meghan Markle seem to have some problematic stuff goin' on upstairs, if you know what I mean. Plus, Prince Harry appears to be completely brainwashed by Meghan. A leaked portion of Harry's memoir reveals they believe the deceased Princess Diana helped them conceive their son, Archie.

\u201cPrince Harry kept a box of Diana's HAIR in his nightstand - and says it helped Meghan get pregnant https://t.co/kp2SAXQsAa\u201d
— Daily Mail U.K. (@Daily Mail U.K.) 1673039018

Harry wrote that he kept locks of his mother Diana's hair on his bedside table. Meghan placed her pregnancy tests besides the hair. When Harry saw this, he apparently said, "let's see what Mummy can do with this situation." When they got a positive test, his first words were, "Thank you, Mummy."

Uhhh. Is anyone else getting some Norman Bates vibes?

Meghan also reportedly visited Princess Diana's grave to ask her for "clarity and guidance." And before you think it can't possibly get more bizarre, Harry said Meghan is "magic" and that she sings to animals and that the animals sing back. His memoir also mentioned marijuana and cocaine use in his teenage years, which could explain some of these occurrences if that drug use is ongoing.

From the looks of it, all is definitely not well with the Royal Family...but it doesn't seem like "racism" is the real problem here.

Editor’s Note

entries.title: 'You're a formulated pickle pauper': Lip reading 'expert' reveals argument between Kevin McCarthy and Matt Gaetz
entries.description:
Kevin McCarthy has ascended to Speaker of the House, the role he and his supporters believed was entitled to him. It took fifteen tries. The first thirteen tries were a debate where conservatives received much need concessions for the American people (shout to them). The fourteenth was just to be a dick. The fifteenth did the trick.

A deal was cut before the fourteenth around, but Matt Gaetz voted against it anyway just because...f*ck you, Kevin. McCarthy had enough. He ran a beeline straight to the dastardly Gaetz to give him what for! No one could hear what they were saying. Thankfully, lip reading experts Bad Lip Reading once again came in clutch.

Something about cereal and pickles.

Everything changes once you know what McCarthy and Gaetz were actually saying#118thCongress #KevinMcCarthy #MattGaetz pic.twitter.com/8Yr7LCtioC
— Bad Lip Reading (@BadLipReading) January 8, 2023

McCarthy was a like "you're a formulated pickle pauper" and "I could flick you in your face."

Gaetz was all like "absolutely, you may not do that." Also, he was hungry for a bowl of Cinnamon Toast Crunch.

And I don't know who Brad is. But it appears he's a horrible person. And he brought a tiger.

It feels good to laugh. Especially at the end of our latest national nightmare, where our elected officials were forced to be in the same room together and vote on things. Now that we have a Speaker of the House, our representatives can get right to work!

As soon as they get back from having four days off. They're all very tired.

Editor’s Note

entries.title: Jordan Peterson releases Ontario College's complaints against him, it's basically a promo for Jordan's Twitter
entries.description:
Jordan Peterson published 56 pages detailing the Ontario College of Psychologists' complaints against him, which led to their assertion that he needs to attend a social media reeducation camp.

\u201cI promised I would post the allegations today. These pages are screenshots of original documents, so everyone interested can decide for themselves what is going on @JustnTrudeau included (take note: @PierrePoilievre). https://t.co/7kekpXTQtt\u201d
— Dr Jordan B Peterson (@Dr Jordan B Peterson) 1672865116

The first complaint claimed Peterson encouraged people to commit suicide on Twitter.

The tweet in question arose from a thread where Peterson said the world will peak at 9.5 billion people, and that it will still be a prosperous world. A scientist responded in disagreement, saying, "Any arguments I have heard for supporting such a large human population completely overlook the huge loss of species and ecosystems resulting from our self-absorbed attention.”

Jordan responded, "You're free to leave at any point."

\u201cJordan Peterson uploaded a document with screenshots of the complaints made against him to the College of Psychologists.\n\nThe first allegation is that he, a licensed psychologist, made a joke about suicide directed at someone on Twitter.\n\nHere's what else it shows.\n\nStrap in.\u201d
— Rachel Gilmore (@Rachel Gilmore) 1673024016

Another complaint said he “publicly opined that no Children’s Aid Society intervention is required in a public review of the Ottawa trucker protest.” It referenced when Peterson tweeted, "children removed?’ how, exactly? Why, exactly? By whom, exactly? Sent to where, exactly? And for how long, exactly? Think this through, Canadians. This is a bad decision.”

\u201c"children removed" how, exactly? Why, exactly? By whom, exactly? Sent to where, exactly? And for how long, exactly? Think this through, Canadians. This is a bad decision.\u201d
— Dr Jordan B Peterson (@Dr Jordan B Peterson) 1645142725

And another complaint mentioned Peterson's iconic "not beautiful" tweet regarding an extra brave and beautiful bathing suit model.

\u201cSorry. Not beautiful. And no amount of authoritarian tolerance is going to change that.\u201d
— Dr Jordan B Peterson (@Dr Jordan B Peterson) 1652728288

The complaint claimed this was "dangerous" for a psychologist to say because of the prevalence of eating disorders in Canada. One could argue a few too many Krispy Kremes can also be "dangerous."

Many complaints centered on Peterson's criticism of transgenderism. One complainant said, "he has failed to advocate for the autonomy and dignity of transgendered persons."

Last June, Peterson's Twitter account was suspended after he tweeted, "Remember when pride was a sin? And Ellen Page just had her breasts removed by a criminal physician." Where is the lie, though?

\u201cOkay, so now you can get banned for calling people by their name? @jordanbpeterson just got suspended from Twitter for writing that Ellen Page removed her breasts. Nothing wrong about it, even if Elliott Page is the preferred name now. \n\nPlease clean this place up, @elonmusk.\u201d
— Ivar Arpi (@Ivar Arpi) 1656540843

There were numerous other complaints about COVID and Peterson's appearance on Joe Rogan. One complainant actually submitted the entire transcript of Peterson's 3-hour appearance on Joe Rogan.

In conclusion, the College of Ontario Psychologists essentially created a highlight reel of Jordan's Twitter. I honestly forgot just how cool he is until I read this document.

Peterson said he will ignore the paperwork that came with each complaint because it's too time-consuming. He submitted an application for judicial review to the Ontario Divisional Court. He also said he will not complete the social media coaching mandated by the college, which would be at his own expense and cost up to $225 an hour.

Editor’s Note

entries.title: WaPo thinks you're all stupid, wants you to nominate Joe Biden's favorite GOPer as our presidential candidate
entries.description:
The Washington Post wants Republicans to nominate former Maryland Governor Larry Hogan as our presidential nominee, and say we're making a big mistake if we don't. This concept was expressed in an OpEd that I'm sure wasn't planted by Hogan's consultants, if they didn't straight up write the piece themselves.

Nope.

If Republicans do not consider Larry Hogan, it will be their loss, the Editorial Board writes. https://t.co/qLdit0ADvc
— Washington Post Opinions (@PostOpinions) January 6, 2023
If Mr. Hogan is headed for political oblivion — and that remains an “if,” for he has been counted out prematurely before — that would be his party’s loss. He remains among the relatively few top-tier elected Republicans who can claim to hold a traditionally conservative, pro-business, anti-tax record untainted by dalliance with the “big lie” that voting fraud played a role in 2020 elections.

I'll be charitable because I would like a robust debate before we nominate who goes up against Ol' Puddinghead. Hogan has a story to tell. He was a successful and popular two-term Republican governor in a blue state. Plus while Trump and DeSantis battle for the base, Hogan has the squishy RINO lane all to himself. We'll call it the Jeb Bush Memorial Highway.

However, you'll forgive me if I believe the Washington Post's intentions to be less than noble. They want us to nominate a guy who, when Joe Biden lashes out at the GOP as being semi-fascist, Larry Hogan is one of the only people he can name as a "good" Republican. A "good" Republican, who he can count on to attack other Republicans if it gets him on television. This is the same Larry Hogan who attacked Florida's Parents Rights in Education Act, then admitted to never reading the bill or knowing much about it.

WaPo is setting the John McCain trap. John McCain was the "good" Republican in 2008. Something I remember first hand, because McCain is one of the reasons I first became interested in politics. He was also my first introduction into who and what the media actually is. McCain was the "good" Republican in 2008 that the GOP had to nominate to stick it to the radical, far-right, talk radio choice... Mitt Romney. Let that one percolate. Then recap what happened four years later.

Within 48 hours of McCain getting the nomination, the media coverage was all about his age, his expensive shoes, and demanding he drops everything he was doing to call out any single person at a rally who made have said something mean about Barack Obama. Or held up a critical sign.

WaPo doesn't want Larry Hogan as the future of the GOP. They want him as a reliable stooge to attack anyone right-leaning on demand and to make things easier for the democrats.

Editor’s Note

entries.title: Watch: Girl has a nutty, is ready to fight entire crowded train car over being told she can't vape
entries.description:
Shout out to @DalekTorgo for remembering to do it for the content and sending this clip over. If you were ever wondering what the Long Island Drunk Train is like (made famous on How I Met Your Mother), it's similar to this only with much more...let's call them "inappropriate displays of affection." It's London. It's a crowded, standing-room-only train car. And a random nutter was told she could not vape on said crowded, standing-room-only train car.

She didn't handle the news well. Whether or not she has OCD and that's why she needs to repeat EVERYTHING multiple times, I'll let you be the judge.

WTF did I just watch? 🤣 pic.twitter.com/JdfLf9ZdX2
— Clown World ™ 🤡 (@ClownWorld_) January 6, 2023

As anyone who has been on a crowded train such as this, the worst thing to happen is for the juice in your headphones to die. This guy looks as if he knows that pain all too well.

But here is what makes this stand out from the multitude of public meltdowns we see scattered across the interwebs. It wasn't the one person with their smartphone out. it was everyone.

That means we have vape girl from multiple angles.

Lol. There are multiple angles. pic.twitter.com/kP7zpHM9ln
— Louder with Crowder Dot Com (@LWCnewswire) January 8, 2023

Regretfully, I find myself wanting more. It's clear Vape Girl's meltdown didn't end after these two minutes and twenty-two seconds. We need to know what happened from here. Did she ever calm down? Did she curse everyone out and repeat the same thing over and over and over again until her stop? What put her in such a foul mood?

I understand that sometimes you just need a hit. But when a hundred people are packed in a metal tube like sardines, it also pays to be nice. Vape Girl chose anger.

Editor’s Note
